tit.e: Town names in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City
Town names in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City
Town names in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 本項京都市上京区の町名（きょうとしかみぎょうくのちょうめい）では、同区内に存在する公称町名を一覧化するとともに、その成立時期・成立過程等について概説する。
sen.e: This section on "Town Names in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City", lists official "Town Names" in Kamigyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
This section on "Town names in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City" lists official town names in Kamigyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: This section on "Town names in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City" lists official town names in Kamigyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.

sen.j: 京都市街地の北部に位置する。
sen.e: Kamigyo Ward is located in the northern part of Kyoto urban area.
Kamigyo Ward is located in the northern part of Kyoto urban area.
Kamigyo Ward is located in the northern part of Kyoto urban area.

sen.j: 東は左京区、北から西は北区 (京都市)、南は中京区に接する。
sen.e: Sakyo Ward is located in the east, Kita Ward (Kyoto City) is located in the north and west, and Nakagyo Ward is located in the south.
Sakyo Ward is located in the east, Kita Ward (Kyoto City) is located in the north and west, and Nakagyo Ward is located in the south.
Sakyo Ward is located in the east, Kita Ward (Kyoto City) is located in the north and west, and Nakagyo Ward is located in the south.

sen.j: 面積7.11平方キロメートル。
sen.e: It covers an area of 7.11 square kilometers.
It covers an area of 7.11 square kilometers.
It covers an area of 7.11 square kilometers.

sen.j: 2009年3月現在の推計人口は約82,000人。
sen.e: Its population projection is about 82,000 as of March 2009.
Its population is estimated to be about 82,000 as of March 2009.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Its population is estimated to be about 82,000 as of March 2009.

sen.j: 京都市制以前の明治12年（1879年）、京都府に「上京区」「下京区」が設置された。
sen.e: 'Kamigyo Ward' and 'Sakyo Ward' were created in Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, which was before the enforcement of municipal system of Kyoto City.
In 1879, 'Kamigyo Ward' and 'Shimogyo Ward' were created in Kyoto Prefecture, which was before the Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City came into effect.
sen.cmt: 京都市制以前→before Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City came into effect とし、他の記事と統一しました。Sakyo Ward →Shimogyo Ward と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1879, 'Kamigyo Ward' and 'Shimogyo Ward' were created in Kyoto Prefecture, which was before the Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City came into effect.

sen.j: 明治21年（1888年）には愛宕郡（おたぎぐん）の一部の村を編入。
sen.e: By 1888, villages which had been a part of Otagi-gun County were integrated into Kamigyo Ward.
In 1888, villages which had been a part of Otagi County were integrated into Kamigyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 愛宕郡→Otagi County とし、他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: In 1888, villages which had been a part of Otagi County were integrated into Kamigyo Ward.

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）、京都市制施行とともに京都市上京区となる。
sen.e: With the enforcement of municipal system of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward became "Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City."
When the Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City came into effect in 1889, Kamigyo Ward became Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 京都市制施行→when the Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City came into effect とし、他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: When the Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City came into effect in 1889, Kamigyo Ward became Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 大正7年（1918年）には愛宕郡及び葛野郡（かどのぐん）の一部の村を編入した。
sen.e: By 1918, Otagi-gun County and villages which had been a part of Kadono-gun County were integrated into Kamigyo Ward.
In 1918, Otagi County and villages which had been a part of Kadono County were integrated into Kamigyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 愛宕郡→Otagi County とし、他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: In 1918, Otagi County and villages which had been a part of Kadono County were integrated into Kamigyo Ward.

sen.j: 昭和4年（1929年）、区の南部と東部の一部地域が分離され、新設の中京区、左京区、東山区に編入された。
sen.e: In 1929, some of the areas of the southern and eastern part of the Kamigyo Ward were split off, and were integrated into the newly created Nakagyo Ward, Sakyo Ward, and Higashiyama Ward.
In 1929, some of the areas of the southern and eastern part of the Kamigyo Ward were split off, and were integrated into the newly created Nakagyo Ward, Sakyo Ward, and Higashiyama Ward.
In 1929, some of the areas of the southern and eastern part of the Kamigyo Ward were split off, and were integrated into the newly created Nakagyo Ward, Sakyo Ward, and Higashiyama Ward.

sen.j: 昭和30年（1955年）に北区を分区して以来、現在の境域となる。
sen.e: The boundary of the present-day Kamigyo Ward was formed after 1955 when the Kita Ward had been separated.
The present boundary of the ward was formed in 1955 when the Kita Ward was separated.
The present boundary of the ward was formed in 1955 when the Kita Ward was separated.

sen.j: 明治以降編入された愛宕郡及び葛野郡の旧村の区域は、現在は北区、左京区及び東山区に属している。
sen.e: Areas of the former villages that belonged to Otagi-gun County and Kadono-gun County which had been integrated into Kamigyo Ward after the Meiji Period, now belongs to Kita Ward, Sakyo Ward, and Higashiyama Ward.
Areas of the former villages in Otagi County and Kadono County which had been integrated into Kamigyo Ward since the Meiji period, now belong to Kita Ward, Sakyo Ward, and Higashiyama Ward.
sen.cmt: 愛宕郡→Otagi County とし、他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: Areas of the former villages in Otagi County and Kadono County which had been integrated into Kamigyo Ward since the Meiji period, now belong to Kita Ward, Sakyo Ward, and Higashiyama Ward.

sen.j: 区の東には鴨川 (淀川水系)、西には天神川が流れ、それぞれ区境をなしている。
sen.e: The Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) runs in the east, and the Tenjin-gawa River runs in the west, and they each serve to form borders between the Wards.
The Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) runs in the east, and the Tenjin-gawa River runs in the west, and they each serve to form borders between the Wards.
The Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) runs in the east, and the Tenjin-gawa River runs in the west, and they each serve to form borders between the Wards.

sen.j: 区の東部には京都御所を含む京都御苑が広大な面積を占める。
sen.e: In the east, there is a Kyoto Gyoen National Garden including Kyoto Imperial Palace that covers large area.
In the east, there is a Kyoto Gyoen National Garden including Kyoto Imperial Palace that covers large area.
In the east, there is a Kyoto Gyoen National Garden including Kyoto Imperial Palace that covers large area.

sen.j: 区内には他に相国寺、北野天満宮、同志社大学キャンパス、京都府庁などがある。
sen.e: Other places in Kamigyo Ward include Shokoku-ji Temple, Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine, Doshisha University Campus, and Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Other places in Kamigyo Ward include Shokoku-ji Temple, Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine, Doshisha University Campus, and Kyoto Prefectural Government.
Other places in Kamigyo Ward include Shokoku-ji Temple, Kitano Tenman-gu Shrine, Doshisha University Campus, and Kyoto Prefectural Government.

tit.j: 通り名を用いた住所表示
tit.e: Indication of Residential Address by the use of street names
Indication of residential address by the use of street names
tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。
tit.e: Indication of residential address by the use of street names

sen.j: 日本における住所表示は、建物の面している道路名ではなく、建物が所在する町や字（あざ）の名をもって表記されるのが普通であるが、京都の市街地においては例外的に「通り名」を用いた住所表示が行われている。
sen.e: Indication of residential address in Japan is usually expressed not by the street names which the building faces, but are expressed by the name of the town or aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) which the building is located; however, indication of residential address with 'street names' is used exceptionally for the urban area of Kyoto.

Indication of residential address in Japan is usually expressed not by the street names which the building faces, but are expressed by the name of the town or aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) where the building is located; however, indication of residential address with 'street names' is used exceptionally for the urban area of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: which→ where と変更しました。
sen.e: Indication of residential address in Japan is usually expressed not by the street names which the building faces, but are expressed by the name of the town or aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) where the building is located; however, indication of residential address with 'street names' is used exceptionally for the urban area of Kyoto.

sen.j: この方式では、まず、家屋、ビルなどが直接面している通りの名を先に言い、その後に直近で交差する通りの名を付記し、「上る」（あがる）、「下る」（さがる）、「東入」（ひがしいる）、「西入」（にしいる）等と表記する。
sen.e: In this style, the street name which a house or a building directly faces is being mentioned first, and then a name of an intersecting street in the nearest area is added, and 'Agaru' (to the north of), 'Sagaru' (to the north of), 'Higashiiru' (to the east of), 'Nishiiru' (to the west of) and so on are written.

According to this method, the street name which a house or a building directly faces is being mentioned first, and then a name of an intersecting street in the nearest area is added, followed by the expressions such as 'Agaru' (to the north of), 'Sagaru' (to the south of), 'Higashiiru' (to the east of) and 'Nishiiru' (to the west of).
sen.cmt: 下がる→to the south of に修正しました。他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: According to this method, the street name which a house or a building directly faces is being mentioned first, and then a name of an intersecting street in the nearest area is added, followed by the expressions such as 'Agaru' (to the north of), 'Sagaru' (to the south of), 'Higashiiru' (to the east of) and 'Nishiiru' (to the west of).

sen.j: A通B西入
sen.e: A-dori street, B-nishiiru
A-dori Street, B-nishiiru:
sen.cmt: Street 大文字にしました。コロンを追加しました。
sen.e: A-dori Street, B-nishiiru:

sen.j: - 建物はA通（東西方向の道）に面しており、かつ、B通（南北方向の道）との交差点から西に入った地点にある。
sen.e: The building faces A-dori street (a street going east and west) and is located in the spot which is in the west from the intersection with B-dori street (a street going north and south.)
The building faces A-dori Street (a street going east and west) and is located in the spot which is in the west from the intersection with B-dori Street (a street going north and south).
sen.cmt: Street 大文字にしました。ピリオドを括弧の外に移動しました。
sen.e: The building faces A-dori Street (a street going east and west) and is located in the spot which is in the west from the intersection with B-dori Street (a street going north and south).

sen.j: C通D上る
sen.e: C-dori street, D-agaru
C-dori Street, D-agaru:
sen.cmt: Street 大文字にしました。コロンを追加しました。
sen.e: C-dori Street, D-agaru:

sen.j: - 建物はC通（南北方向の道）に面しており、かつ、D通（東西方向の道）との交差点から北に入った地点にある。
sen.e: The building faces C-dori street (a street going north and south) and is located in the spot which is in the north from the intersection with D-dori street (a street going east and west.)
The building faces C-dori Street (a street going north and south) and is located in the spot which is in the north from the intersection with D-dori Street (a street going east and west).
sen.cmt: Street 大文字にしました。ピリオドを括弧の外に移動しました。
sen.e: The building faces C-dori Street (a street going north and south) and is located in the spot which is in the north from the intersection with D-dori Street (a street going east and west).

sen.j: 住所は上記のような通り名のみで表示して町名を省略する場合もあり、「A通B西入」等の後に町名を併記する場合もある。
sen.e: There are instances where a town name is abbreviated and an address is indicated by the use of street names alone, and there are also instances where town names are written along after 'A-dori street, B-nishiiru' and so on.
Some addresses are indicated only by the street names as shown above, while others are followed by town names after the indication such as 'A-dori Street, B-nishiiru.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Some addresses are indicated only by the street names as shown above, while others are followed by town names after the indication such as 'A-dori Street, B-nishiiru.'

sen.j: たとえば、京都府庁の所在地は上京区薮ノ内町であるが、これを「上京区下立売通新町西入薮ノ内町」と表示する。
sen.e: For example, the location of Kyoto Prefectural Government is in Yabunouchi-cho, Kamigyo Ward, but this is indicated as 'Kamigyo Ward Shimotachiuri-dori Shinmachi-nishiiru Yabunouchi-cho.'
For example, the location of Kyoto Prefectural Government is in Yabunouchi-cho, Kamigyo Ward, but this is indicated as 'Shimotachiuri-dori Shinmachi-nishiiru Yabunouchi-cho, Kamigyo Ward.'
sen.cmt: 住所表記を変更しました。
sen.e: For example, the location of Kyoto Prefectural Government is in Yabunouchi-cho, Kamigyo Ward, but this is indicated as 'Shimotachiuri-dori Shinmachi-nishiiru Yabunouchi-cho, Kamigyo Ward.'

tit.e: Summary of Town Names in Kamigyo Ward
Summary of town names in Kamigyo Ward
tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。
tit.e: Summary of town names in Kamigyo Ward

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（前記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがあるが、上京区内の町名はすべて単独町名である。
sen.e: The Town Names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-Cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-Cho' and 'Kikuya-Cho', and all of the town names in Kamigyo Ward uses independent name of a town.

The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho,' and all of the town names in Kamigyo Ward uses independent town names.
sen.cmt: 「○○町」→○○-cho と小文字にしました。
sen.e: The town names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is the former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho,' and all of the town names in Kamigyo Ward uses independent town names.

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば577町（1980年現在）である（「笹屋町一・二・三丁目」と「笹屋四・五丁目」をそれぞれ1町とカウントしている）。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 577 declared towns in 1980 ('1, 2, and 3 Chome, Sasaya-cho' and '4 and 5 Chome, Sasaya' are counted as one town respectively).

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 577 declared towns in 1980. ('1, 2, and 3-chome, Sasaya-cho' and '4 and 5-chome, Sasaya' are counted as one town respectively.)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを括弧の中に移動しました。「丁目」→「-chome」としました。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 577 declared towns in 1980. ('1, 2, and 3-chome, Sasaya-cho' and '4 and 5-chome, Sasaya' are counted as one town respectively.)

sen.j: この町数は2009年現在も変化していない。
sen.e: The number of towns remain unchanged as of 2009.
The number of towns remains unchanged as of 2009.
The number of towns remains unchanged as of 2009.

sen.j: 京都市においては「住居表示に関する法律」に基づく住居表示は実施されておらず、市内の公称町名については、「京都市区の所管区域条例」（昭和24年4月1日京都市条例第7号）が根拠となっている。
sen.e: Indication of residential address based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not implemented in Kyoto City, and the official town names within the city are based on 'Municipal ordinance of jurisdiction districts of Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949).

Indication of residential address based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not implemented in Kyoto City, and the official town names within the city are based on 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949).
sen.cmt: 「京都市区の所管区域条例」 大文字にして他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: Indication of residential address based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not implemented in Kyoto City, and the official town names within the city are based on 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949).

sen.j: 「所管区域条例」には上京区に属する町として581町が挙げられており、上述の「577町」との間に差がある。
sen.e: Municipal ordinance of jurisdiction districts' mentions 581 towns that belong to Kamigyo Ward, and there is a difference between the '577 towns' mentioned above.
581 towns are mentioned in the 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts' as those that belong to Kamigyo Ward, and there is a difference between the '577 towns' mentioned above.
sen.cmt: 語順を一部変更しました。
sen.e: 581 towns are mentioned in the 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts' as those that belong to Kamigyo Ward, and there is a difference between the '577 towns' mentioned above.

sen.j: これは、条例においては「笹屋町一・二・三丁目」「笹屋四・五丁目」「猪熊一・二丁目」を丁目ごとに1町と数えているため、４町分の差を生じたものである。
sen.e: This is because 'Chome' in '1, 2 and 3 chome, Sasaya-cho', '4 and 5 Chome, Sasaya', and '1and 2 Chome, Inokuma' are being counted as one town, resulting in the difference by four towns.
This is because 'chome' in '1, 2 and 3-chome, Sasaya-cho', '4 and 5-chome, Sasaya', and '1 and 2-chome, Inokuma' are being counted as one town, resulting in the difference by four towns.
This is because 'chome' in '1, 2 and 3-chome, Sasaya-cho', '4 and 5-chome, Sasaya', and '1 and 2-chome, Inokuma' are being counted as one town, resulting in the difference by four towns.

sen.j: 近世の京都では、二条通以北を上京、以南を下京と称し、上京には「上京十二組」「禁裏六丁組」、下京には「下京八組」という町組（ちょうぐみ）が組織されていた。
sen.e: In the early modern Kyoto, areas north of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Kamigyo, and areas south of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Shimogyo; and chogumi (town society) called 'Twelve town societies of Kamigyo' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' were formed in Kamigyo, and 'Eight town societies of Shimogyo' were formed in Shimogyo.
sen.cmt: 「上京十二組」「下京八組」は定訳不明です。『京都府の歴史』（山川出版社）内の説明などを参考に訳出致しました。
sen.e: In the early modern Kyoto, the area north of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Kamigyo, and the area south of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Shimogyo; and chogumi (town society) called 'Twelve town societies of Kamigyo' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' were formed in Kamigyo, and 'Eight town societies of Shimogyo' were formed in Shimogyo.

In the early modern Kyoto, the area north of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Kamigyo, and the area south of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Shimogyo; and chogumi (town society) called 'Twelve town societies of Kamigyo' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' were formed in Kamigyo, and 'Eight town societies of Shimogyo' were formed in Shimogyo.

sen.j: 町組は近隣の町の連合体、自治組織であり、その起源は判然としないが、室町時代には存在が確認される。
sen.e: Chogumi was an union of neighboring towns and a self-governing organization, and although its origin is unclear, its existence during the Muromachi Period is ascertained.
Chogumi was an union of neighboring towns and a self-governing organization, and although its origin is unclear, its existence can be confirmed already in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 「室町時代には～」以降の翻訳を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Chogumi was an union of neighboring towns and a self-governing organization, and although its origin is unclear, its existence can be confirmed already in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）、京都府の成立とともに、上京の町組は1 - 45番組に編成されるが、翌明治2年（1869年）には町組改正で上京1 - 33番組に再編成された。
sen.e: With the establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, the chogumi of Kamigyo was organized into kumi Nos. 1 to 45, but in the following year in 1869, they were reorganized into Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33.

With the establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, the chogumi of Kamigyo was organized into bangumi (town unit) Nos. 1 to 45, but in the following year in 1869, they were reorganized into Kamigyo bangumi Nos. 1 to 33.
sen.cmt: 番組→bangumi (twon unit) としました。
sen.e: With the establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, the chogumi of Kamigyo was organized into bangumi (town unit) Nos. 1 to 45, but in the following year in 1869, they were reorganized into Kamigyo bangumi Nos. 1 to 33.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）には上京1 - 33番組が上京1 - 33区と改められ、33に区分される点は変わらないが、旧1番組が3区になるなど、番号を振る順番が変化している。
sen.e: By 1872, Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33 were reorganized into to Kamigyo Ward Nos. 1 to 33, and although it remains unchanged in terms of dividing the ward into 33 divisions, the order in which the wards are being numbered are changed, such as the former town society No.1 being numbered to Ward No. 3.

In 1872, Kamigyo bangumi Nos. 1 to 33 were reorganized into to Kamigyo ward Nos. 1 to 33, and although it remains unchanged in terms of dividing the ward into 33, the order in which the wards are being numbered are changed, such as the former bangumi No.1 being numbered to ward No. 3.

In 1872, Kamigyo bangumi Nos. 1 to 33 were reorganized into to Kamigyo ward Nos. 1 to 33, and although it remains unchanged in terms of dividing the ward into 33, the order in which the wards are being numbered are changed, such as the former bangumi No.1 being numbered to ward No. 3.

sen.j: 明治12年（1879年）、京都府に上京区・下京区が設置されると、前述の「区」は、番号はそのままで「組」と改称、上京1 - 33組となる。
sen.e: When Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward were created inside Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, the above-mentioned 'ward' were renamed as 'kumi' without making changes to their numbers, and became Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33.

When Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward were created inside Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, the above-mentioned 'wards' were renamed as 'kumi' without making changes to their numbers, and became Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33.
sen.cmt: ward→ wards に変更しました。
sen.e: When Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward were created inside Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, the above-mentioned 'wards' were renamed as 'kumi' without making changes to their numbers, and became Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33.

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）、京都市制とともに、上京区・下京区は京都市の区となる。
sen.e: With the enforcement of Municipal system of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward became the ward of Kyoto City.
With the enforcement of Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward became the wards of Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 京都市制→Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City とし、他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: With the enforcement of Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward became the wards of Kyoto City.

sen.j: なお、近世と違い、二条通りではなく三条通が上京・下京の境となっている。
sen.e: Further, unlike the early-modern times in Kyoto, instead of Nijo-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street became the border between Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward.
Unlike the early-modern times in Kyoto, instead of Nijo-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street became the border between Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Unlike the early-modern times in Kyoto, instead of Nijo-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street became the border between Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward.

sen.j: この間、明治15年（1882年）には上京12組が同11組に編入。
sen.e: In the meantime, by 1882, Kamigyo kumi No.12 of was integrated into Kamigyo kumi No.11.
In the meantime, by 1882, Kamigyo kumi No.12 of was integrated into Kamigyo kumi No.11.
In the meantime, by 1882, Kamigyo kumi No.12 of was integrated into Kamigyo kumi No.11.

sen.j: 明治21年（1888年）には同年上京区に編入された旧愛宕郡の村域に上京34組が設定された。
sen.e: By 1888, 34 kumi of Kamigyo was created in the area of the former Otagi-gun County which had been integrated into the Kamigyo Ward in the same year.
In 1888, Kamigyo kumi No. 34 was created in the area of the former Otagi County which had been integrated into the Kamigyo Ward in the same year.
sen.cmt: 愛宕郡→Otagi County とし、他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: In 1888, Kamigyo kumi No. 34 was created in the area of the former Otagi County which had been integrated into the Kamigyo Ward in the same year.

sen.j: 明治25年（1892年）には「組」を「学区」に改組。
sen.e: By 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district.'
In 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district.'
In 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district.'

sen.j: 旧上京1 - 33組は、上京第1 - 28学区に編成された。
sen.e: The former Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33 were reorganized into Kamigyo school district Nos. 1 to 28.
The former Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33 were reorganized into Kamigyo school district Nos. 1 to 28.
The former Kamigyo kumi Nos. 1 to 33 were reorganized into Kamigyo school district Nos. 1 to 28.

sen.j: 2ないし3の組を統合して1つの学区とした例があるため、数は33から28に減少している。
sen.e: The total decreased from 33 to 28, for there were cases where two or three kumi were combined to form one school district.
The total decreased from 33 to 28, for there were cases where two or three kumi were combined to form one school district.
The total decreased from 33 to 28, for there were cases where two or three kumi were combined to form one school district.

sen.j: このうち、第1 - 17学区がほぼ現在の上京区に相当し、第18 - 26学区は中京区の一部、27・28学区は左京区の一部にあたる。
sen.e: Of the 28 school districts, district Nos. 1 to 17 were nearly equivalent to the present-day Kamigyo Ward, and Nos. 8 to 26 equals to a part of Nakagyo Ward, and school districts Nos. 27 and 28 equals to a part of Sakyo Ward.

Of the 28 school districts, district Nos. 1 to 17 were nearly equivalent to the present-day Kamigyo Ward; district Nos. 18 to 26 equal to a part of Nakagyo Ward while district Nos. 27 and 28 equal to a part of Sakyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 文法などを一部修正しました。
sen.e: Of the 28 school districts, district Nos. 1 to 17 were nearly equivalent to the present-day Kamigyo Ward; district Nos. 18 to 26 equal to a part of Nakagyo Ward while district Nos. 27 and 28 equal to a part of Sakyo Ward.

sen.j: 昭和4年（1929年）に上京区の一部は新設の中京区、東山区、左京区に分離された。
sen.e: In 1929, a part of Kamigyo Ward was split into the newly created Nakagyo Ward, Higashiyama Ward, and Sakyo Ward.
In 1929, a part of Kamigyo Ward was split into the newly created Nakagyo Ward, Higashiyama Ward, and Sakyo Ward.
In 1929, a part of Kamigyo Ward was split into the newly created Nakagyo Ward, Higashiyama Ward, and Sakyo Ward.

sen.j: 同年、学区名に小学校名を付して「成逸学区」「室町学区」のように称するようになる。
sen.e: In the same year, the name of elementary schools were added to the names of the school districts to be referred to as 'Seiitsu school district', 'Muromachi school district', and so on.
In the same year, the names of elementary schools were added to the names of the school districts to be referred to as 'Seiitsu school district,' 'Muromachi school district,' and so on.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置をクォーテーションマークの内側に移動しました。
sen.e: In the same year, the names of elementary schools were added to the names of the school districts to be referred to as 'Seiitsu school district,' 'Muromachi school district,' and so on.

sen.j: 昭和16年（1941年）の国民学校令の発布とともに学区制は廃止された。
sen.e: With the proclamation of Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) in 1941, school district system was abolished.
With the proclamation of Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) in 1941, school district system was abolished.
With the proclamation of Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) in 1941, school district system was abolished.

sen.j: したがって、これらの学区は現在では正式の行政区域ではないが、「京都の元学区」という形で、地域の通称としては現在も使われている。
sen.e: Therefore, although these school districts are not official administrative districts, they are used in the present-day as common names of an area in the form of 'old school districts of Kyoto.'
Therefore, these school districts are not official administrative district todady, but they are still used as aliases of areas in the form of 'former school districts.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Therefore, these school districts are not official administrative district todady, but they are still used as aliases of areas in the form of 'former school districts.'

sen.j: なお、学校の統廃合等により、元学区と現在の通学区とは一致していない。
sen.e: Furthermore, due to the integration and abolition of schools, there is no consistency between the old school districts and the present-day attendance units.
Meanwhile, due to the integration and abolition of schools, there is no consistency between the old school districts and the present-day attendance units.
Meanwhile, due to the integration and abolition of schools, there is no consistency between the old school districts and the present-day attendance units.

sen.j: 下の表は、上述の変遷をまとめたものである。
sen.e: The table below is the summary of the changes described above.
The table below is the summary of the changes described above.
The table below is the summary of the changes described above.

sen.j: 上京区の元学区の変遷
sen.e: The changes of former school districts in Kamigyo Ward
The changes of former school districts in Kamigyo Ward
The changes of former school districts in Kamigyo Ward

sen.j: 区内の町名は、おおむね近世以来の町界・町名を現代に引き継いでいる。
sen.e: The town names in Kamigyo Ward are mostly passed on to the present-day from the borders of towns and town names of the early-modern times.
Town names in Kamigyo Ward have succeeded most of the borders and names of the towns since the early-modern times.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Town names in Kamigyo Ward have succeeded most of the borders and names of the towns since the early-modern times.

sen.j: ただし、明治時代の初期に数か町が合併して新たに命名された町、北野天神の社領など、従来町名のなかった土地に新たに起立した町名などもかなりの数が存在する。
sen.e: However, there are a great number of town names including towns which had been newly named by the merging of few towns in the early Meiji Period or those which were made for areas where town names had not existed, such as the estate of Kitano Tenjin Shrine.

However, there are quite a few towns that were established by merger of several towns in the early Meiji period and given a new name, or towns that were newly established in areas that didn't have traditional town names such as the estate of Kitano Tenjin Shrine.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: However, there are quite a few towns that were established by merger of several towns in the early Meiji period and given a new name, or towns that were newly established in areas that didn't have traditional town names such as the estate of Kitano Tenjin Shrine.

sen.j: 京都御苑の地域には「京都御苑」という町名が付けられている。
sen.e: The area of Kyoto Imperial Garden is given a town name, 'Kyoto Gyoen.'
The area of Kyoto Imperial Garden is given a town name, 'Kyoto Gyoen.'
The area of Kyoto Imperial Garden is given a town name, 'Kyoto Gyoen.'

sen.j: 上京区の町としての「京都御苑」は昭和35年（1960年）に成立した。
sen.e: Kyoto Gyoen' as a town of Kamigyo Ward was established in 1960.
This 'Kyoto Gyoen' as a town of Kamigyo Ward was established in 1960.
sen.cmt: 文頭に一部追加しました。
sen.e: This 'Kyoto Gyoen' as a town of Kamigyo Ward was established in 1960.

sen.j: 区内の他の町は遅くとも明治時代の初期には成立している。
sen.e: Other towns in Kamigyo Ward were established by late as Meiji Period.
Other towns in Kamigyo Ward had been established by the early Meiji period at the latest.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部修正しました。
sen.e: Other towns in Kamigyo Ward had been established by the early Meiji period at the latest.

sen.j: 区の北西部、旧翔鸞学区の区域は、大部分が北野天神の社領で、明治元年（1868年）に上京に編入されたものである。
sen.e: Most of the area of the former Shoran school district in the northwestern part of Kamigyo Ward is the estate of Kitano Tenjin Shrine which was integrated into Kamigyo in 1868.
Most of the area of the former Shoran school district in the northwestern part of Kamigyo Ward is the estate of Kitano Tenjin Shrine which was integrated into Kamigyo in 1868.
Most of the area of the former Shoran school district in the northwestern part of Kamigyo Ward is the estate of Kitano Tenjin Shrine which was integrated into Kamigyo in 1868.

sen.j: ただし、この地区の町名は大部分が近世以来のものである。
sen.e: However, most of the town names in this area are passed on after the early-modern times.
However, most of the town names in this area have been passed on since the early-modern times.
sen.cmt: are passed on after →have been passed on since～としました。
sen.e: However, most of the town names in this area have been passed on since the early-modern times.

sen.j: 区の南西部、仁和学区の区域は、大部分が旧葛野郡聚楽村、西ノ京村、大将軍村の各一部で、これらの村のうち早くから町地化していた区域が明治元年に上京に編入されたものである。
sen.e: Most of the area of Ninna school district in the southwest part of Kamigyo Ward is a part of the former Juraku village, Kadono County, Nishinokyo mura, Taishogun mura, and those areas in these villages which had developed into towns from earlier times were integrated in to Kamigyo since 1868.

Most of the area of Ninna school district in the southwest part of Kamigyo Ward is a part of the former Juraku village, Nishinokyo village and Taishogun village of Kadono County, and the areas in these villages which had developed into towns from earlier times were integrated into Kamigyo in 1868.
sen.cmt: since→ in に変更しました。旧葛野郡 聚楽村、西ノ京村、大将軍村 の表現を変更しました（３村とも旧葛野郡に属する、という表現にしました）。
sen.e: Most of the area of Ninna school district in the southwest part of Kamigyo Ward is a part of the former Juraku village, Nishinokyo village and Taishogun village of Kadono County, and the areas in these villages which had developed into towns from earlier times were integrated into Kamigyo in 1868.

sen.j: この地区の町名も大部分は近世以来のものである。
sen.e: Most of the town names in this area is also derived after the early-modern times.
Most of the town names in this area have been also derived since the early-modern times.
sen.cmt: have been derived since としました。
sen.e: Most of the town names in this area have been also derived since the early-modern times.

sen.j: ※五十音順の町名一覧は外部リンクの郵便番号一覧を参照。
sen.e: For the town names listed in order of fifty Japanese syllables, refer to the external link with the postal code list.
For the town names listed in the order of fifty Japanese syllables, refer to the external link with the postal code list.
sen.cmt: in the order of としました。
sen.e: For the town names listed in the order of fifty Japanese syllables, refer to the external link with the postal code list.

tit.e: Same town names in Kamigyo Ward
Same town names in the ward
tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
tit.e: Same town names in the ward

sen.j: 上京区では、同一の町名が区内の別の場所に複数存在する例が下記の33組ある。
sen.e: There are 33 pairs mentioned below which are examples of the same town names that exist in different places within Kamigyo Ward.
There are 33 pairs mentioned below which are examples of the same town names that exist in different places within Kamigyo Ward.
There are 33 pairs mentioned below which are examples of the same town names that exist in different places within Kamigyo Ward.

sen.j: たとえば、「今出川町」という町は、京都御苑の北東、「今出川通烏丸西入る」にあるほか、そこから数百メートル西に離れた「元誓願寺通浄福寺西入る」にも同じ名の町がある。
sen.e: For example, a town called 'Imadegawa-cho,' other than in 'Nishi-iru, Karasuma, Imadegawa-dori Street' which is located in the northeast of Kyoto Imperial Palace, exists in 'Nishi-iru, Jofuku-ji Temple, Moto seiganji-dori Street' which is few meters to the west.

For example, a town called 'Imadegawa-cho,' other than in 'Imadegawa-dori Karasuma-nishiiru,' which is located in the northeast of Kyoto Gyoen National Garden, exists in 'Motoseiganji-dori Jofukuji-nishiiru' which is few hundred meters to the west.
sen.cmt: 数百メートル を追加しました。住所表記を変更しました。
sen.e: For example, a town called 'Imadegawa-cho,' other than in 'Imadegawa-dori Karasuma-nishiiru,' which is located in the northeast of Kyoto Gyoen National Garden, exists in 'Motoseiganji-dori Jofukuji-nishiiru' which is few hundred meters to the west.

sen.j: これらはいわゆる飛地ではなく、起源を異にする別個の町である。
sen.e: These are not the so-called detached towns, but individual towns with different origins.
These are not the so-called detached towns, but individual towns with different origins.
These are not the so-called detached towns, but individual towns with different origins.

sen.j: この2つの「今出川町」には別個の郵便番号が設定されている（他の同一町名についても同様）。
sen.e: These two 'Imadegawa cho' have different zip codes (it is also the same with other towns with the same town names.)
These two 'Imadegawa-cho' have different postal codes (the same is true for other towns that have the same name).
sen.cmt: zip code→ postal code としました。全体を変更しました。
sen.e: These two 'Imadegawa-cho' have different postal codes (the same is true for other towns that have the same name).

sen.j: 上京区内に同一町名が複数存在するもの
sen.e: Towns in Kamigyo Ward that have more than one town with the same name
Towns in Kamigyo Ward that have more than one town with the same name
Towns in Kamigyo Ward that have more than one town with the same name
